alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Oneida (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Forest, northeastern Lincoln, central Oneida and northwestern Langlade Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 336 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms near Willow Reservoir, or 17 miles west of Rhinelander, moving southeast at 15 mph. Additional storms were located just southeast of Rhinelander moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Localized brief torrential rainfall is also likely that may cause ponding of water in low lying areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water in low lying areas is also possible. Locations impacted include... Woodboro...Jeffris,Harrison and Parrish. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
